news_header: Boeing faced a challenging year with a $3.9 billion loss in Q4 and a total annual loss of $11.8 billion, amid security issues and labor disputes.
news_text: Boeing has had a difficult year, ending with a $3.9 billion loss in the last quarter and a total annual loss of $11.8 billion. The company's revenue dropped by 31% year-over-year to $15.2 billion. CEO Kelly Ortberg stated that steps are being taken to regain customer trust. Additionally, Boeing is under increased regulatory scrutiny following a serious incident involving its 737 Max aircraft.
